name: Pediatric Primary Tumor
title: Pediatric Primary Tumor
subtitle: International Retinoblastoma Staging System
notes:
**Note 1:** For Retinoblastoma, Pediatric Staging is based on the International Retinoblastoma Staging System (IRSS) and records the stage group only.  
* Primary sources of information: surgical pathology report, imaging (Stage IV disease only)

**Note 2:** If there is bilateral disease, code the most advanced stage at diagnosis.
* Code 4 for Laterality [NAACCR # 410] data item

**Note 3:** Pathological staging information from an enucleation always takes precedence over clinical staging, except in cases with neoadjuvant treatment where clinical disease is as extensive as or more extensive than disease at surgery.
footnotes: (1)	Aitken JF, Youlden D, O’Neill L, Gupta S, Frazier AL, eds. Childhood cancer staging for population registries according to the Toronto Childhood Cancer Stage Guidelines – Version 2. Cancer Council Queensland and Cancer Australia: Brisbane, Australia; 2021.
rows:
Stage 0: 
* Tumor confined to the globe
* Enucleation has not been performed
* Patient treated conservatively with either focal therapies or chemotherapy

Stage I: 
* Enucleation with negative margins or UNKNOWN margin status (R0)
   - Completely resected histologically

Stage II
* Enucleation with positive/microscopic residual tumor

Stage III: 
* Regional extension 
   - Orbit
   - Preauricular extension
   - Cervical lymph node involvement

Not documented in medical record
International Retinoblastoma Staging System not assessed

Death certificate only
